Home → Recommendations & reviews → Young Adult

Young Adult

Are you interested in what makes us well? We've launched a new Open Space group for 11-17 year-olds at Chantry Library. Find out more →

Reviews, recommendations, posts and ideas for and by young adults.

Second Best Friend by Non Pratt

Written by Emma Maguire · Published Apr 17, 2018

Second Best Friend is a quick, pacey story of friendship, self-discovery and politics, optimised for readers with dyslexia and visual stress.

The Unpredictability of Being Human by Linni Ingemundsen

Written by Emily Mitchell · Published Apr 12, 2018

The Unpredictability of Being Human is a relatively quick read with a quirky, relatable main character.

This Monstrous Thing by Mackenzi Lee

Written by Kate Ashton · Published Apr 10, 2018

Inspired by Frankenstein, This Monstrous Thing explores what it is to be human, what makes us human and who the story's real monster is.

Witchborn by Nicholas Bowling

Written by Emily Mitchell · Published Apr 5, 2018

Witchborn is a brilliant concoction of Tudor politics, magic and one heck of a gripping plot.

Mark the 50th anniversary of the assassination of Martin Luther King with our favourite BAME authors for young adults

Written by Sophie Green · Published Apr 4, 2018

Iconic civil rights activist Martin Luther King was assassinated 50 years ago this April. In his memory we have compiled a list of outstanding BAME authors of young adult literature.

New Young Adult books for April 2018

Written by Sophie Green · Published Mar 29, 2018

New titles for the young and young-at-heart from Charlie Higson, Lucy Worsley and Linwood Barclay

Long Way Down by Jason Reynolds

Written by Emily Mitchell · Published Mar 29, 2018

Long Way Down is an unforgettable book that you won’t be able to put down.

The Red Ribbon by Lucy Adlington

Written by Emily Mitchell · Published Mar 22, 2018

The Red Ribbon is a brilliant story about the power of stories and the cost of survival.

Pick up an amazing graphic novel from the 2018 Excelsior Award shortlist

Written by Sophie Green · Published Mar 22, 2018

The Excelsior Award highlights the best graphic novels published each year across genre and style. The winners are decided by pupils at participating secondary schools across the UK.

Undercover Princess by Connie Glynn

Written by Amélie Magotte · Published Mar 20, 2018

Undercover Princess will appeal to anyone who loves drama, humour and wild characters doing wild things.

About our Young Adult section

Book reviews, reading suggestions and blog posts from our staff and young adult readers. Want to write for our website? Email us at help@suffolklibraries.co.uk.
